intro: Cephaloschefflera catanduanensis, commonly known as the Catanduanes schefflera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to the island of Catanduanes in the Philippines and is characterized by its dense, umbrella-like arrangement of leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually leathery and have a glossy appearance, while its flowers are small and greenish-white. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
